document.docAuthor: Slimani, Noura, Moulet, Pierre, Chen, Ping-Ping, Nieser, Nico, Pluot-Sigwalt, Dominique, Boumaïza, Moncef & Guilbert, Eric
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist, distribution, and a new record of Nepomorphan water bugs (Hemiptera: Heteroptera) in northern Tunisia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist, distribution, and a new record of Nepomorphan water bugs (Hemiptera: Heteroptera) in northern Tunisia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments. Micronectinae has been raised to family rank by Nieser ( 2008 ), therefore, we prefer to treat
Micronecta
under family Micronectidae instead of Corixidae .
Micronecta scholtzi
is most abundant and widespread during the warm season. It was commonly collected in sand at edge of slow-flowing regions of lotic environments, up to 398 m asl. The first record of the species for Tunisia is reported by
Puton ( 1886 )
in Southern Tunisia (Oudref, Gabès) under the name
Sigara laevissima Puton.
